page.title: 14Dunston School Plantation
page.content: Dunston School has a plantation which is close to Nocton Woods. The last batch of trees was planted on 8.3.85. The trees planted were oak, wild cherry, silver birch, hairy birch, ash and larch.A plaque marks the beginning of the plantation. The planting led to a whole range of work eg sketching, bark rubbing, measuring. A display was arranged in the hall and a talk was given by the forester Mr. J. Ockenden. The land is owned by Nocton Farms but they have kindly allowed Dunston School to use this plantation for their contined studies.
